title: Alan Jackson - Drive(MP3){CTShoN}[CTRC]
description:
Drive is the tenth studio album by American country music artist Alan
Jackson.
Released in 2002 on Arista Nashville, the album produced
Jackson's highest-debuting single on the Hot Country Songs charts in
the Number One hit "Where Were You (When the World Stopped
Turning)", a ballad written in response to the September 11, 2001
terrorist attacks. "Drive (For Daddy Gene)", "Work in Progress", and
"That'd Be Alright" were also released as singles, peaking at #1,
#3, and #2, respectively, on the same chart; "Designated Drinker"
also reached #44 without officially being released. In addition, all
four released singles crossed over to pop radio and cracked the Top
40 on the Billboard Hot 100, peaking at #28, #28, #35 and #29,
respectively

Studio album by: Alan Jackson

Released: January 15, 2002

Genre: Country

Length: 49:37

Label: Arista Nashville


Producer: Keith Stegall
